.NET 5

/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
Stride editor and toolchain is now running with .NET 5!
Stride editor e toolchain está agora em execução com .NET 5!
Stride editor and toolchain is now running with .NET 5!
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
Runtime has been working with .NET Core for a few versions already.
Runtime tem trabalhado com . NET Core para algumas versões já.
Runtime has been working with .NET Core for a few versions already.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
This allows us to have scripts and custom assets in a project targetting <g1>.NET Standard 2.1</g1> or <g2>.NET 5</g2>.
Isso nos permite ter scripts e ativos personalizados em um projeto segmentando <g1>. NET Standard 2.1</g1> ou <g2>.NET 5</g2>.
This allows us to have scripts and custom assets in a project targetting <g1>.NET Standard 2.1</g1> or <g2>.NET 5</g2>.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
If you have scripts or custom assets in a .NET Framework project rather than a .NET Standard project, you can still choose between <g1>.NET 5</g1> and <g2>.NET Framework</g2> within the launcher:

Se você tiver scripts ou ativos personalizados em um projeto .NET Framework em vez de um projeto .NET Standard, você ainda pode escolher entre <g1>.NET 5</g1> e <g2>.NET Framework</g2> dentro do lançador:
If you have scripts or custom assets in a .NET Framework project rather than a .NET Standard project, you can still choose between <g1>.NET 5</g1> and <g2>.NET Framework</g2> within the launcher:
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
<x1/>Framework selection in launcher<x2/>

<x1/>Framework selection in launcher<x2/>

The framework will also be displayed in the Game Studio toolbar for easier identification while both coexist.
O framework também será exibido na barra de ferramentas Game Studio para facilitar a identificação enquanto ambos coexistem.
The framework will also be displayed in the Game Studio toolbar for easier identification while both coexist.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
.NET Framework version can be considered deprecated and will likely be removed in a future release (likely 4.1) to allow us to take full advantage of <g1>C# 8.0</g1> and soon-to-come <g2>C# 9.0</g2>.

. A versão NET Framework pode ser considerada desprecaída e provavelmente será removida em uma versão futura (como 4.1) para nos permitir aproveitar plenamente de <g1>C# 8.0</g1> e em breve-to-come <g2>C# 9.0</g2>.
.NET Framework version can be considered deprecated and will likely be removed in a future release (likely 4.1) to allow us to take full advantage of <g1>C# 8.0</g1> and soon-to-come <g2>C# 9.0</g2>.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md

We also expect dropping .NET Framework and supporting only .NET 5 will greatly simplify our installation process since we won't depend on specific workloads or packages of Visual Studio being installed anymore.

Também esperamos cair . NET Framework e suportando apenas . O NET 5 simplificará muito nosso processo de instalação, já que não dependeremos de cargas de trabalho ou pacotes específicos do Visual Studio sendo instalado.

We also expect dropping .NET Framework and supporting only .NET 5 will greatly simplify our installation process since we won't depend on specific workloads or packages of Visual Studio being installed anymore.

Graphics API: different selection mechanism + Vulkan improvements
API gráfica: mecanismo de seleção diferente + melhorias Vulkan
Graphics API: different selection mechanism + Vulkan improvements
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
There's been a big overhaul on Stride build system to make Graphics API selection work in a more future-proof way.
Houve uma grande revisão no sistema de compilação Stride para fazer a seleção de APIs gráfica funcionar de uma forma mais à prova de futuro.
There's been a big overhaul on Stride build system to make Graphics API selection work in a more future-proof way.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
It was previously relying on the custom <g1>RuntimeIdentifier</g1> being set in the solution.
Ele estava anteriormente confiando no personalizado <g1>RuntimeIdentifier</g1> sendo definido na solução.
It was previously relying on the custom <g1>RuntimeIdentifier</g1> being set in the solution.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
This didn't work very well because it was completely orthogonal to the existing <g2>RuntimeIdentifier</g2>, and sometimes not having good fallbacks.
Isso não funcionou muito bem porque era completamente ortogonal para o existente <g2>RuntimeIdentifier</g2>, e às vezes não ter boas desvantagens.
This didn't work very well because it was completely orthogonal to the existing <g2>RuntimeIdentifier</g2>, and sometimes not having good fallbacks.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
From now on, the user project will use <g1>StrideGraphicsApi</g1> in the <g2>.csproj</g2> project file to specify the graphics API.
A partir de agora, o projeto de usuário usará <g1>StrideGraphicsApi</g1> no arquivo de projeto <g2>.csproj</g2> para especificar a API gráfica.
From now on, the user project will use <g1>StrideGraphicsApi</g1> in the <g2>.csproj</g2> project file to specify the graphics API.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
We hope to expose this in the editor later.
Esperamos expor isso no editor mais tarde.
We hope to expose this in the editor later.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md

We also took the opportunity to improve the state of Vulkan renderer (thanks to a switch to <g1>Vortice.Vulkan bindings</g1> from <g2>Amer Koleci</g2>) and automatize graphics unit tests, currently running for D3D11 and Vulkan.

Também aproveitamos a oportunidade para melhorar o estado do renderizador Vulkan (graças a um interruptor para <g1>Vortice.Vulkan vinculações</g1> de <g2>Amer Koleci</g2>) e automatizar testes de unidade gráfica, atualmente em execução para D3D11 e Vulkan.

We also took the opportunity to improve the state of Vulkan renderer (thanks to a switch to <g1>Vortice.Vulkan bindings</g1> from <g2>Amer Koleci</g2>) and automatize graphics unit tests, currently running for D3D11 and Vulkan.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-4.0.md
It's still a work in progress so expect more in future releases.
Ainda é um trabalho em andamento, então espere mais em versões futuras.
It's still a work in progress so expect more in future releases.
